content:
Learned Incident Entry
Description: Container exceeded memory limit
Logs: Pattern: OOMKilled\nMeaning: Container exceeded memory limit.\nLikely Root Cause: Memory leak or insufficient allocation.\nRecommended Fix: Increase memory limit or optimize memory usage.
Executive Summary: Order service pods experienced repeated restarts due to memory limit exceedance.
Root Cause: Memory leak or insufficient allocation.
Severity: High
Impacted Services: Order Service
Indicators Detected: OOMKilled, CrashLoopBackOff, exit code 137
Resolution Steps: Describe pod using kubectl describe pod. | Check container memory limits. | Review recent deployments. | Rollback deployment if needed. | Increase memory allocation.
Preventive Actions: Add load testing before production release.
Confidence Score: 0.9
